links.title: Cap'n Proto: Schema Language
links.description:
Like Protocol Buffers and Thrift (but unlike JSON or MessagePack), Capân Proto messages are
strongly-typed and not self-describing. You must define your message structure in a special
language, then invoke the Capân Proto compiler (capnp compile) to generate source code to
manipulate that message type in your desired language.

links.title: Philippine ethnic group has most Denisovan DNA - Uppsala University, Sweden
links.description: The Philippine ethnic group Ayta Magbukon has the highest proportion of genes from our extinct relatives, the Denisovans, a new study led by Uppsala University shows. Their Denisovan share far exceeds that of ethnic groups in Papua New Guinea, who previously held the record. The study is published in the scientific journal Current Biology.
links.original_title: Philippine ethnic group has most Denisovan DNA

links.title: Nuclear and mitochondrial DNA sequences from two Denisovan individuals
links.description: Denisovans are a sister group of Neandertals that were identified on the basis of a nuclear genome sequence from a bone from Denisova Cave (Siberia). The only other Denisovan specimen described to date is a molar from the same site. We present here nuclear DNA sequences from this molar and a morphological description, as well as mitochondrial and nuclear DNA sequences from another molar from Denisova Cave, thus extending the number of Denisovan i...

links.title: Philippine Ayta possess the highest level of Denisovan ancestry in the world
links.description:
Larena et al. reveal Philippine Ayta to possess the highest level of Denisovan ancestry
in the world—∼30%–40% greater than that of Australopapuans—consistent with an independent
admixture event into Negritos from Denisovans. The Philippine archipelago is thus
likely inhabited by multiple archaic groups prior to the arrival of modern humans.

links.description: OPUS is a growing collection of translated texts from the web. In the OPUS project we try to convert and align free online data, to add linguistic annotation, and to provide the community with a publicly available parallel corpus. OPUS is based on open source products and the corpus is also delivered as an open content package. We used several tools to compile the current collection. All pre-processing is done automatically. No manual corrections...

It's unnecessary and complicated at almost
      every layer. At best I can congratulate someone for quickly and simply

      amount of complexity I'm willing to tolerate is proportional to the size of
      the problem being solved.

Guix is an advanced distribution of the GNU operating system

Guix supports transactional upgrades and roll-backs, unprivileged

Guix supports declarative system configuration for transparent and
reproducible operating systems.

links.title: Firmware - Debian Wiki
links.description:
Translation(s): English -  Español - Français - Italiano  Firmware refers to embedded software which controls electronic devices. Well-defined boundaries between firmware and software do not exist, as both terms cover some of the same code. Typically, the term firmware deals with low-level operations in a device, without which the device would be completely non-functional (read more on Wikipedia). Contents

Description: SystemRescue (also known as SystemRescueCd) is a Linux
system rescue toolkit available as a bootable medium for administrating or
repairing your system and data after a crash. It aims to provide an easy way to
carry out admin tasks on your computer, such as creating and editing the hard
disk partitions. It comes with a lot of Linux system utilities
such as GParted, fsarchiver, filesystem tools and basic tools (editors, midnight
comma...

links.title: Document Proxy Icons in MacOS 11 and 12 as a — Ahem — Proxy for Apple’s Current UI Design Sensibilities
links.description: The Mac’s breakthrough was establishing an interface where you could see — and thus discover through visual exploration — not just what you *had* done, but what you *could* do.

links.title: The Mac and the iPad arenât meeting in the middle yet
links.description:
At the end of 2010, John Gruber of Daring Fireball wrote in a Macworld column,
 The central conceit of the iPad is that itâs a portable computer that does lessâand because it does less, what it does do, it does better, more simply, and more elegantly. Apple can only begin phasing out the Mac if and when iOS expands to allow us to do everything we can do on the Mac.

links.title: On This Day In Twistory
links.description:
This site shows you "On This Day" Tweets.
		Stick your Twitter username in the box, and see what you were saying on this day in previous years.
		This is a "best effort" service with no guarantee.
